p: The Canadian cannabis market has been steadily growing. In 2017, about 4.9 million Canadians aged 15 to 64 spent an estimated CAD 5.7 billion on cannabis for medical and non-medical purposes, which amounts to around USD 1200 per cannabis consumer. The federal government legalized the recreational use of cannabis in 2018. The total cannabis market in Canada, including medical and recreational use of cannabis products, is expected to generate up to CAD 7 billion in sales in 2020 with about half of this coming from the legal recreational drug market [ 50]. No data are available on the industry of cannabis in the Canada related to animals.
